column2: (based UN International Standard Industrial Classification of All Economic Activities, Rev.4 -http://unstats.un.org/unsd/cr/registry/regcst.asp?Cl=27)
column6: argumentation: based on the social risks in the industry
column8: argumentation: based on ecological impact on the planterary boundaries in the supply cahin (studies and the use of quantitative models - e.g. ecological footprint - will be applied herefor)
column10: argumentation: based on the products / service impact on the planterary boundaries in the use phase (studies and the use of quantitative models - e.g. ecological footprint - will be applied herefor)
column12: argumentation: based on the sectors direct impact in the production phase on the planterary boundaries (studies and the use of quantitative models will be applied herefor); e.g. sehr hoch: The sector has a major impact of various planetary boundaries
column14: argumentation: the weighting is depending on the impact the industry has particularly on the adjacent environment

argumentation: based on the sectors direct impact in the production phase on the planterary boundaries (studies and the use of quantitative models will be applied herefor)

column2: A - agriculture, forestry management, fishing industry
column10: the main impacts are in the production phase
column12: major direct impact on various planetary boundaries in the production (climate change, N/P-cycle, biodiversity, land-use-change)
Please note: This industry is very heterogen.

column2: Ca - Food production, drinks and tobacco (C10, C11, C12)
Cb - Textile production, clothing, leather and leather products (C13, C14, C15)
Cc - Paper and forest products, also printed matter (C16, C17, C18)
Cd - Production of petrochemical products and plastics (C19, C20;C22)
Cg - Production of metal and metallic products (excl. machines and equipment) (C24, C25)
Ch - Production of electronic equipment, instruments and components as well as computers (C26, C27, C28)
D - Electric, Gas, Steam and Refrigeration

column12: major impact on climate change (see d3) and impacting land-use-change
